alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cook; De Kalb; Kane; Lake; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 12:51AM CDT until July 05 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL BOONE, NORTHEASTERN DE KALB, NORTHERN COOK, NORTHERN KANE, SOUTHERN LAKE IL AND SOUTHERN MCHENRY COUNTIES... At 1251 AM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour continuing across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with isolated higher amounts. Some areas may see additional rainfall of up to 2 inches. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. Locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elgin, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Schaumburg, Palatine, Skokie, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Hoffman Estates, Glenview, Buffalo Grove, Bartlett, Crystal Lake, Streamwood, Hanover Park, Carpentersville, Wheeling, Park Ridge and Northbrook. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, farmland, roadways, and and other low lying areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cook; De Kalb; Kane; Lake; McHenry
